column4: hi guys, does anyone know how I could find my hard drive while running a live CD
work with, and move the data to an ext drive
you are using the dapper live cd, right? if you downloaded a newer one, it should work automatically
how many hard disks are in your machine? just one?
not sure it's in a Dell laptop
try typing  sudo mount /dev/hda and press tab. does it add a number?
i mean: type "sudo mount /dev/hda" and press tab two times. what options do you get?
what about "sudo mount /dev/sda" and tab two times
when i press tab the second time and / appears
when I typed "sudo mount /dev/sda" and pressed tab two times, nothing happened
neither with hda or sda it suggests something like hda1 or sda1? strange
that is strange. i think you should try downloading the latest version and trying with that live cd - it should detect your disk automatically
thanks I will try with the lastest live cd. downloading now
